content.raw: I'm not sure about that :thinking: , I think even if we added a link, we do still need the inertial data, which we take from either a `msg` or `parse` it from the `sdf` file.
content.html: I'm not sure about that , I think even if we added a link, we do still need the inertial data, which we take from either a msg or parse it from the sdf file.

content.raw:
Sorry, I always come to point out corner cases :sweat_smile: 

The `simple_arm` model is one of the few models in the database which has a ~~[rotation on the inertial pose](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo_models/src/ca22037469dcc6acdb568de11e322bfadf256d0e/simple_arm/model.sdf?fileviewer=file-view-default#model.sdf-125)~~ **off-diagonal term in the inertia matrix**. It looks like it isn't being taken into account, note on gzclient on the right how the box is slightly rotated:

![inertiaclients.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/r77Gja/images/1806436023-inertiaclients.png)
content.html:
Sorry, I always come to point out corner cases

The simple_arm model is one of the few models in the database which has a rotation on the inertial pose off-diagonal term in the inertia matrix. It looks like it isn't being taken into account, note on gzclient on the right how the box is slightly rotated:

content.html: Do I add a TODO with the issue number in the code above the viewInertia function?

content.raw:
No worries :)

so thats what the `ignition::math::MassMatrix3d` does umm :thinking:

content.html:
No worries :)

so thats what the ignition::math::MassMatrix3d does umm

content.raw: This feature was relatively recently added to [Gazebo 7](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/pull-requests/2354/fix-inertiavisual-for-non-diagonal-inertia/diff#chg-gazebo/rendering/InertiaVisual.cc). I'm ok with ticketing an issue to tackle this later. Sorry about the confusion.
content.html: This feature was relatively recently added to Gazebo 7. I'm ok with ticketing an issue to tackle this later. Sorry about the confusion.

content.raw:
Ahh sorry, the rotation isn't because of the pose, it's because it has an [off-diagonal](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo_models/src/ca22037469dcc6acdb568de11e322bfadf256d0e/simple_arm/model.sdf?fileviewer=file-view-default#model.sdf-132) element (ixz):

~~~
        <inertia>
          <ixx>0.031</ixx>
          <ixy>0</ixy>
          <ixz>0.005</ixz>
          <iyy>0.07275</iyy>
          <iyz>0</iyz>
          <izz>0.04475</izz>
        </inertia>
~~~
content.html:
Ahh sorry, the rotation isn't because of the pose, it's because it has an off-diagonal element (ixz):

        <inertia>
          <ixx>0.031</ixx>
          <ixy>0</ixy>
          <ixz>0.005</ixz>
          <iyy>0.07275</iyy>
          <iyz>0</iyz>
          <izz>0.04475</izz>
        </inertia>

content.raw:
I'm not sure but isn't the rotation expressed by the last three numbers? they are all zeros.
```
<link name="arm_elbow_pan">
      <pose>1.05 0 1.1 0 0 0</pose>
      <inertial>
        <pose>0.0875 0 0.083333 0 0 0</pose>
```
content.html:
I'm not sure but isn't the rotation expressed by the last three numbers? they are all zeros.

<link name="arm_elbow_pan">
      <pose>1.05 0 1.1 0 0 0</pose>
      <inertial>
        <pose>0.0875 0 0.083333 0 0 0</pose>

content.raw: Ok, fair enough. Even though on threejs it is a member of Box, and not of Scene. But we can leave it like this.

content.raw: I'm debugging it and it is never triggered, maybe I should remove it
content.html: I'm debugging it and it is never triggered, maybe I should remove it

content.raw: I wonder if this test is really checking what it proposes itself to check. Since `obj` has no children, `scene.viewInertia` returns at `if (model.children.length === 0)`, which means the `view_inertia` event is not changing anything in the scene.
content.html: I wonder if this test is really checking what it proposes itself to check. Since obj has no children, scene.viewInertia returns at if (model.children.length === 0), which means the view_inertia event is not changing anything in the scene.

content.raw: I'm starting to think that this condition would never be true :thinking:
content.html: I'm starting to think that this condition would never be true

content.raw: I named it `setFromObject` just for consistency, since this is basically the `setFromObject`  function from threejs with just a few changes.
content.html: I named it setFromObject just for consistency, since this is basically the setFromObject function from threejs with just a few changes.

content.raw: Probably good to mention this is the world-axis-aligned bounding box
content.html: Probably good to mention this is the world-axis-aligned bounding box

content.raw: How about calling this function `computeBoundingBox`? I was a bit confused about what it was supposed to be doing
content.html: How about calling this function computeBoundingBox? I was a bit confused about what it was supposed to be doing

content.raw:
This makes sense.

I actually found out that I didn't multiply the box rotation with the inertial rotation like you did in this line 

``` c++
    // Apply additional rotation by boxRot
    this->Load(ignition::math::Pose3d(xyz, q * boxRot), boxScale);
```

Yeah you really are a good tester :sweat_smile:

Thanks for noticing that.
content.html:
This makes sense.

I actually found out that I didn't multiply the box rotation with the inertial rotation like you did in this line 

    // Apply additional rotation by boxRot
    this->Load(ignition::math::Pose3d(xyz, q * boxRot), boxScale);

Yeah you really are a good tester

Thanks for noticing that.
